meanings.definition: Doing good or causing good to be done; kindly; charitable.
meanings.sent1: The beneficent lady always helped those in need.
meanings.sent2: The community praised the beneficent actions of the local charity.
meanings.sent3: The beneficent cat shared its food with a stray kitten.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as beneficent as a warm ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The beneficent act of planting trees will benefit the environment for years to come.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or performing acts of kindness or charity.
meanings.sent1: The king was known for his beneficent rule over the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The beneficent nature of the teacher inspired her students to be kind.
meanings.sent3: The beneficent squirrel shared its nuts with the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a beneficent effect on everyone who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The beneficent deeds of the volunteers brought hope to the community.
